name: hyper-electron
description: Access Hyper electron instance from a cli process

scripts.test: npm run setup --silent && ava && xo --ignore example.js --ignore index.js
scripts.cover-test: npm run setup --silent && nyc ava && npm run xo --ignore example.js --ignore index.js

readme:
# hyper-electron

> Access Hyper electron instance from a cli process

background details relevant to understanding what this module does

## Usage

description of the example

```js
const hyperElectron = require('hyper-electron');

console.log({hyperElectron});
```

This will output

```
```

[![Travis Build Status](https://img.shields.io/travis/parro-it/hyper-electron/master.svg)](http://travis-ci.org/parro-it/hyper-electron)
[![Code Climate](https://img.shields.io/codeclimate/github/parro-it/hyper-electron.svg)](https://codeclimate.com/github/parro-it/hyper-electron)
[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/repos/github/parro-it/hyper-electron/badge.svg?branch=master)](https://coveralls.io/github/parro-it/hyper-electron?branch=master)
[![NPM downloads](https://img.shields.io/npm/dt/hyper-electron.svg)](https://npmjs.org/package/hyper-electron)


## API

```js
const hyperElectron = (): object
```

description of the function signature

## Install

With [npm](https://npmjs.org/) installed, run

```
$ npm install hyper-electron
```
